sen.j: 岩松 家純（いわまつ いえずみ）は、室町時代中期の岩松氏の当主。
sen.e: Iezumi IWAMATSU (岩松 家純) was the head of the Iwamatsu clan in the middle of the Muromachi period.

Iezumi IWAMATSU was the head of the Iwamatsu clan who lived during the middle of the Muromachi period.
He was the founder of the Reibu family.
He was the founder of the Reibu family.

sen.j: 父の岩松満純は応永23年（1416年）に外祖父（異説あり）の上杉禅秀の乱で上杉禅秀（氏憲）に味方し、応永24年（1417年）に室町幕府による追討を受けて処刑されている。
sen.e: When the War of Zenshu UESUGI broke out in 1416, Iezumi's father Mitsuzumi IWAMATSU took the side of Iezumi's maternal grandfather (opinions are divided on this relationship) Zenshu (Ujinori) UESUGI, and in 1417, Iezumi's father was hunted down and executed by the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 父の死後、祖父の岩松満国によって家純は廃嫡された。
sen.e: After Iezumi's father was killed, Iezumi was disinherited by his grandfather Mitsukuni IWAMATSU, so he was not able to succeed to the reigns of the family and became a priest.

sen.j: よって家督を継げず、出家した。
sen.e: Therefore, he was not able to inherit the family estate, and became a priest.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。

sen.j: そして幕府の追討を恐れて西国に逃れた。
sen.e: And being afraid that the Bakufu would hunt him down, he escaped to the western part of Japan.
He feared persecution by the Bakufu, and escaped to western Japan.

sen.j: しかし永享の乱後に足利義教によって罪を赦免されて還俗した。
sen.e: But after the Eikyo War, Iezumi was pardoned by Yoshinori ASHIKAGA and returned to secular life.

sen.j: これは満純の死後、岩松家を継いだ従弟（満純の弟・満春の子）の岩松持国が鎌倉公方派であったため、家純を幕府派として擁立しようという義教の策略だったといわれる。
sen.e: This is said to have been a plot of Yoshinori to back up Iezumi as a member of the Bakufu group, because Mochikuni IWAMATSU, Iezumi's cousin (a child of Mitsuzumi's younger brother Mitsuharu), who succeeded to the Iwamatsu family after Mitsuzumi's death belonged to Kamakura kubo (Governor-general of the Kanto region) group.

sen.e: This was said to have been Yoshinori's plot to back Iezumi as a member of the Bakufu group in opposition to his cousin, Mochikuni IWAMATSU(a child of Mitsuz umi's younger brother Mitsuharu) of the Kamakura Kubo group, who had succeeded the IWAMATSU family after Mitsuzumi's death.

sen.j: このため、岩松氏は五十子に所領を持つ家純と、新田庄に所領を持つ持国の礼部派と京兆派に分裂した。
sen.e: As a result, the Iwamatsu clan was divided into two groups: the Reibu group of Iezumi who had the territory in Irako, and the Keicho group of Mochikuni who had the territory in Nitta no sho.
sen.cmt: 原文では関係がわかりにくいですが、家純が礼部家、持国が京兆家の祖であると思われます。

sen.j: 家純は、享徳の乱において上杉氏に味方し、古河公方に属した持国を誘って味方につけるなど活躍した。
sen.e: Iezumi took the side of the Uesugi clan in the Kyotoku War, and he made a lot of activities such as tempting Mochikuni who belonged to the Koga kubo side to stand by the Uesugi clan.

sen.j: 寛正2年（1461年）には、再び離反しようとした持国・次郎父子を討ち取っている。
sen.e: In 1461, he killed Mochikuni and Jiro, the father and his son, who were about to defect to the enemy again.

sen.j: 文明 (日本)元年（1469年）、家純は、持国の子で京兆家を継いだ三郎岩松成兼（後閑氏祖）を追って新田庄に入った。
sen.e: In 1469, Iezumi entered Nitta no sho chasing after Saburo Shigekane IWAMATSU (the founder of the Gokan clan) who was Mochikuni's child and succeeded to the Keicho family, and Iezumi unified the Iwamatsu clan that had been divided for many years.

sen.j: そこで長年分裂していた岩松氏を統一した。
sen.e: There, he unified the IWAMATSU clan that had been divided for many years.

sen.j: 長尾景春の乱が起こると、家純はこれまで協力していた堀越公方派から古河公方派に転換した。
sen.e: When the Kageharu NAGAO War broke out, Iezumi switched from the Horikoshi kubo group with which he had been cooperating until then to the Koga kubo group.

sen.e: When his legitimate son Akizumi IWAMATSU opposed it and rose in revolt against him, Iezumi disinherited his son and appointed his grandson Hisazumi IWAMATSU (Akizumi's son) to his successor.
